intro: Microlicia serrulata var. calvescens, commonly known as the serrated microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and botanical gardens.
